heisig_chinese_memo: The mouth on the left eats a whole box full of goods and then starts to vomit them out again.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the goods in the side open box (區) come out of your mouth (口) when you vomit
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: If your food moves from you stomach region to your mouth, then you vomit.
humanum_full_description_en:
" vomit " can be pronounced differently due to the descriptive meaning, which means different semantics. When reading flat tones, " vomit " is used as an onomatopoeia to express the language of children. "Guang Yun‧ Hou Yun": "Oh, vomit, babble, babbling." "Xunzi‧Fu Guo": "Carry things to support the people, follow it, vomit." Bai Juyi's poem "Nian Jin Luanzi": " When the situation changed, I was dumb and started learning Chinese."

When " vomit " is pronounced flat, it can also be used as "讴" to mean singing. For example, "Han Shu-Zhu Maichen Biography": "His wife also bears and wears Xiangfu, but the buyer does not sing and vomit." Yan Shi's ancient note: "To vomit is to vomit.

When pronounced on the sound, " vomit " means vomiting, originally written as " Ou ", see " Ou ".

Today there is another way to pronounce " vomit " in the Mandarin dialect, which means to be frustrated, even if people are angry. This usage can be found in recent vernacular novels, such as the 16th chapter of "Water Margin": "This animal does not vomit to death."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " mouth ", " zone " sound, used as an onomatopoeia, also means vomiting or making people angry.
humanum_full_description:
「嘔」因聲別義可有不同讀法，表示不同語義。讀平聲調時，「嘔」作象聲詞用，表示小兒之語。《廣韻‧侯韻》：「嘔，嘔唲，小兒語也。」《荀子‧富國》：「垂事養民，拊循之，唲嘔也。」白居易詩〈念金鑾子〉：「況念夭化時，嘔啞初學語。」

　　「嘔」讀平聲時還可通作「謳」，表示歌唱。如《漢書‧朱買臣傳》：「其妻亦負戴相隨，數止買臣毋歌嘔道中。」顏師古注：「嘔讀曰謳。」

　　讀上聲時，「嘔」表示嘔吐，本作「歐」，參見「歐」。

　　今天官話方言中「嘔」另有去聲讀法，表示慪氣，即使人生氣。這種用法見於晚近白話文小說，如《水滸全傳》第16回：「這畜生不嘔死俺。」
humanum_short_description: 從「口」，「區」聲，用做象聲詞，也表示嘔吐或使人生氣。

「 嘔 」因聲別義可有不同讀法，表示不同語義。讀平聲調時，「 嘔 」作象聲詞用，表示小兒之語。《廣韻‧侯韻》：「嘔，嘔唲，小兒語也。」《荀子‧富國》：「垂事養民，拊循之，唲嘔也。」白居易詩〈念金鑾子〉：「況念夭化時，嘔啞初學語。」 「 嘔 」讀平聲時還可通作「 謳 」，表示歌唱。如《漢書‧朱買臣傳》：「其妻亦負戴相隨，數止買臣毋歌嘔道中。」顏師古注：「嘔讀曰謳。」 讀上聲時，「 嘔 」表示嘔吐，本作「 歐 」，參見「 歐 」。 今天官話方言中「 嘔 」另有去聲讀法，表示慪氣，即使人生氣。這種用法見於晚近白話文小說，如《水滸全傳》第16回：「這畜生不嘔死俺。」
" vomit" can be pronounced differently due to the descriptive meaning, which means different semantics. When reading flat tones, " vomit" is used as an onomatopoeia to express the language of children. "Guang Yun‧ Hou Yun": "Oh, vomit, babble, babbling." "Xunzi‧Fu Guo": "Carry things to support the people, follow it, vomit." Bai Juyi's poem "Nian Jin Luanzi": " When the situation changed, I was dumb and started learning Chinese." When " vomit" is pronounced flat, it can also be used as " 讴" to mean singing. For example, "Han Shu-Zhu Maichen Biography": "His wife also bears and wears Xiangfu, but the buyer does not sing and vomit." Yan Shi's ancient note: "To vomit is to vomit. When pronounced on the sound, " vomit" means vomiting, originally written as " Ou", see " Ou". Today there is another way to pronounce " vomit" in the Mandarin dialect, which means to be frustrated, even if people are angry. This usage can be found in recent vernacular novels, such as the 16th chapter of "Water Margin": "This animal does not vomit to death."

嘔字的基本解释

嘔
ǒu
见“呕”。

嘔字的汉语字典释义

[①]［ōu］
［《廣韻》烏侯切，平侯，影。］
“呕1”的繁体字。
(1)象声词。参见“嘔軋”、“嘔啞”。
(2)通“謳”。歌唱。
(3)叹词。表示招呼、应答、提醒等。
(4)语气助词。
[②]［ǒu］
［《廣韻》烏后切，上厚，影。］
“呕2”的繁体字。
(1)吐。
(2)叹词。表示惊讶。
[③]［òu］
“呕3”的繁体字。
(1)使人生气。
(2)多用于故意逗引人生气。
(3)呕气，生闷气。
[④]［xū］
［《集韻》匈于切，平虞，曉。］
“呕4”的繁体字。
(1)和悦貌。参见“嘔4嘔”、“嘔4喻”。
(2)通“煦”。抚育。

嘔字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【口字部】　嘔； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页206第04
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?烏侯切，音歐。【廣韻】唲嘔，小兒語也。【荀子·富國篇】唲嘔之。　又【博雅】嘔嘔，喜也。　又水名。【周禮·夏官·職方氏】幷州，其川曰虖池、嘔夷。【釋文】嘔，烏侯反。　又與謳通。【前漢·朱買臣傳】其妻亦負戴相隨，數止買臣，毋歌嘔道中。　又【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?匈于切，音訏。【集韻】悅言也。【正韻】慈愛之聲。【史記·韓信傳】言語嘔嘔。【漢書】作姁姁。【集韻】同呴。　又【集韻】虧于切，音區。嘔夷，水名。【周禮·嘔夷釋文】一音驅。　又【集韻】【類篇】?春朱切，音樞。怒聲。　又【廣韻】烏后切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】於口切，?音歐。【廣韻】與歐同，吐也。【左傳·哀二年】?子曰：吾伏弢嘔血，鼓音不衰。【釋文】嘔，本又作?。【集韻】或作?㰶??。　又【集韻】【韻會】?威遇切，音嫗。【集韻】和悅貌。【前漢·王褒傳】嘔喩受之。應劭讀。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [ōu]
["Guangyun" Wuhou cut, Pinghou, shadow. ]
Traditional characters for "vomit 1".
(1) Onomatopoeia. See "vomit rolling", "vomit dumb".
(2) Through "讴". singing.
(3) Interjection. Indicates greetings, answers, reminders, etc.
(4) Modal particles.
[②] [ǒu]
["Guangyun" Wu after cutting, thick, shadow. ]
Traditional characters for "vomit 2".
(1) Spit.
(2) Interjection. Expressed surprise.
[③] [òu]
Traditional characters for "vomit 3".
(1) Make people angry.
(2) It is mostly used to deliberately arouse people's anger.
(3) Vomiting, sulking.
[④]［xū］
["Jiyun" Xiong Yuqie, Pingyu, Xiao. ]
Traditional characters for "vomit 4".
(1) Harmonious appearance. See "4 vomits" and "4 vomits".
(2) Link "Xu". Upbringing.
